title: Gallery Talk: Walking Intently
hero_caption: Claude Cahun. Object, 1936. Through prior gift of Mrs. Gilbert W. Chapman.
short_description: In this gallery talk, return to the Surrealist’s tradition of walking—walking alone, walking together, walking to find oneself, walking to get lost, walking to encounter the unexpected. We’ll travel through the galleries and reflect on the intentional act of walking, while looking at art and talking about it.
description:
Inspired by Lori Waxman’s study “Keep Walking Intently”, join this gallery talk to reflect on walking and the Surrealist’s practice—walking alone, walking together, walking to find oneself, walking to get lost, walking to encounter the unexpected. We’ll travel through the galleries and reflect on the intentional act of walking, while looking at art and talking about it.

Please note that the artwork on this page may not be featured during the gallery talk.
